title: Varda gets reentry license for space manufacturing capsule
summary: After months of effort and one rejected application, Varda Space Industries said Feb. 14 it has received an FAA license for its first reentry capsule.

title: SpaceX launches U.S. missile-defense satellites
summary: The USSF-124 mission carried six small satellites: two for the Missile Defense Agency and four for the Space Development Agency.

title: Startup pitches AI tool to prevent Pentagon procurement blunders
summary: Company says AI can flag risks in procurements by analyzing historical data

title: After 8 months stuck in orbit, Varda’s drug spacecraft gets FAA approval to return
summary: Space startup Varda received long-awaited approval from the Federal Aviation Administration to bring its first spacecraft back to earth after a stint manufacturing drugs in space.

title: Chinese launch startup Orienspace secures $83.5 million
summary: Chinese launch firm Orienspace announced a series B funding round shortly after its successful debut launch, as China moves to nurture its growing commercial space ecosystem.

title: Fueling a spacecraft while it’s on a rocket? “Not trivial,” SpaceX official says.
summary: "We’re trying to create a marketplace where a marketplace does not exist."

title: Governments worldwide use satellite communication to close a critical gap
summary: Thorleif Astrup Hallund argues that the world must improve satellite communication resilience to prepare for an unpredictable world.

title: UKSA Contributes £7.4M to Exploration Missions from Around the World
summary:
The UK Space Agency has committed £7.4 million in contributions to eight international missions that will explore the Moon, Mars, Venus, and our Universe. “From exploring water on Mars and the possibility of sustained human activity on the red planet to how galaxies evolved over time, our more than £7 million investment is pushing the […]
The post UKSA Contributes £7.4M to Exploration Missions from Around the World appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: BAE Systems wins approval for Ball Aerospace acquisition
summary: BAE Systems will complete its $5.5 billion acquisition of Ball Aerospace in days after securing regulatory approvals for the deal.

title: Fueling issue delays Intuitive Machines lunar lander launch
summary: SpaceX postponed the launch of an Intuitive Machines lunar lander by a day after encountering a problem fueling the spacecraft on the launch pad.
